page.title: 19The Old Schoolroom
page.content: Known originally as Church House and situated at the entrance to the churchyard, the Old Schoolroom was built at the end of the 15th century for use as an ale house. Beer was brewed in the huge fireplace and sold to raise money for church maintenance. Later the upper floor was used as a schoolroom and the lower floor was a workhouse from about 1700.The old and sick were given simple tasks to perform and provided with food and shelter. There was also a small room for use as an overnight jail. Nowadays the Old Schoolroom is used for all sorts of activities such as yoga, ballet, Brownies, Guides,W.I. meetings and playgroup. The Old Schoolroom is a beautiful building, tastefully restored and possibly the only building of its type in the country.
